intro: Molina cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical molina, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often growing in dense clusters. Molina cylindrica is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
